title: Bob Dylan accepts honorary doctorate from Berklee – just in time for tribute show
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Bob Dylan accepts an honorary doctorate from Berklee College of Music, the first from an American university since 1970.
Berklee holds a tribute concert for Dylan, "Watching the River Flow," on November 5, highlighting his impact on roots music.
Berklee President Jim Lucchese calls the moment a reaffirmation of the creative impulse that built the institution.

title: Revolution reportedly set to hire Marko Mitrovic as head coach
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution set to hire Marko Mitrovic as head coach, reports The Athletic's Tom Bogert.
Mitrovic led U.S. U-20 team to quarterfinals at 2025 FIFA U-20 World Cup, including wins over France and Italy.
Mitrovic previously coached Serbia's youth teams and served as an assistant with Chicago Fire and Reading.

title: Trevor Story decides to stay with Red Sox, won’t opt out of contract
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Trevor Story will stay with the Boston Red Sox, opting to complete the final two years of his contract.
Story batted .263 with 25 home runs and 96 RBIs in 157 games during the 2025 season.
Story's decision secures one infield spot as Boston eyes Alex Bregman and strategizes for Marcelo Mayer's role.

title: Marat Khusnutdinov keeps cashing in on his opportunities with Bruins
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Marat Khusnutdinov scored the decisive goal in Boston Bruins' shootout win against the New York Islanders.
Khusnutdinov, filling in for injured Elias Lindholm, has netted key goals in the last three Bruins games.
Coach Marco Sturm praises Khusnutdinov's determination and impact on recent Bruins victories, earning him a top-line position.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Nov. 5)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Acton home sales include a Colonial on 16 Silver Hill Road for $1,160,000 and an antique on 56 Windsor Ave for $990,000.
Andover features a Colonial on 166 Greenwood Road with 3,897 square feet and four bedrooms, sold for $1,300,000.
Arlington's property sales include a one-family Cape Cod at 57 Hodge Road, 1,152 square feet, priced at $2,275,000.

title: ‘Landslide’: Santana beats out Baker, Wu says, while Culpepper wins D7
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Henry Santana secured reelection to the Boston City Council, defeating former Councilor Frank Baker in at-large race.
Rev. Miniard Culpepper won the District 7 City Council seat, which was left vacant by Tania Fernandes Anderson.
All incumbent district councilors secured reelection, maintaining their positions on the Boston City Council.

title: Jake Wilson to be Somerville’s next mayor, unofficial results show
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jake Wilson won the Somerville mayoral race with 11,185 votes compared to opponent Willie Burnley Jr.'s 9,054 votes.
Wilson's campaign focused on improving city services, addressing housing, street safety, and rodent issues in Somerville.
Outgoing Mayor Katjana Ballantyne was eliminated in the preliminary elections, leading to the race between Wilson and Burnley.

title: Lowell police seeking public’s help with details about fatal hit-and-run
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Lowell police are investigating a fatal hit-and-run that occurred on Oct. 30, seeking the public's assistance.
A woman was struck by a car on the 700 block of Chelmsford Street and later pronounced dead at a local hospital.
Police have identified the vehicle involved but request more information; contact Lowell police at 978-937-3200.

title: ‘This is just the beginning’: Nonbinding Israel divestment ballot question passes in Somerville
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Nonbinding ballot Question 3 urging divestment from companies supporting Israel passed with 55.7% votes in Somerville.
Somerville for Palestine led the campaign, gathering over 11,000 signatures and overcoming legal challenges against the ballot.
Opposition claims the measure sows division and distracts from local issues, while proponents urge Somerville to act on divestment.

title: Tom Brady just revealed that his dog Junie is a clone of Lua, his deceased furry friend
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Tom Brady's new dog Junie is a clone of his deceased dog Lua, created by Colossal Biosciences.
Brady invested in Colossal, which used non-invasive methods to clone Lua, who died in December 2023.
Colossal Biosciences recently acquired Viagen, a leading animal cloning company known for cloning various species.
